title: 1998 RFL Division One
text:
The 1998 Division One Championship season was the second tier of British <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> during the 1998 season. The competition featured eleven teams, with <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a> winning the league and the inaugural Grand Final.
Championship.
The league was won by <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a>. Wakefield also won the inaugural First Division Grand Final against <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a>, and were awarded a place in the <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a>. Despite being on the losing side, <a href="Richard%20Chapman%20%28rugby%20league%29">Richard Chapman</a> won the <a href="Tom%20Bergin%20Trophy">Tom Bergin Trophy</a>.
No teams were relegated, as the First and Second Divisions were merged to form a single division which would later become known as the Northern Ford Premiership.
Play-offs.
Week 1.
Featherstone Rovers 22–12 Swinton Lions
Hull Kingston Rovers 18–2 Dewsbury Rams
Week 2.
Wakefield Trinity 19–16 Hull Kingston Rovers
Dewsbury Rams 10–20 Featherstone Rovers
Week 3.
Hull Kingston Rovers 6–54 Featherstone Rovers
